poem:
Title: "In the Cracks of Democracy"

Earth has swallowed the once proud square,
Laid bare and stripped of Freedom's dare;
The dust of Soweto breathes unrest,
In the heart where democracy was blessed.

"Belongs to all," they claimed in strife,
Now echoes hollow through the charred life.
This was not the dream for which they bled,
The rainbow nation's colours, shed.
